membership.label: Membership
membership.description: Types that describe membership, participation, or observer status in organizations and forums

hierarchy.label: Hierarchy
hierarchy.description: Types that describe parent-child or organizational hierarchy relationships

cooperation.label: Cooperation
cooperation.description: Types that describe bilateral relations, partnerships, and cooperative agreements

participation.label: Participation
participation.description: Types that describe involvement in events, engagements, and discussions

temporal.label: Temporal
temporal.description: Types that describe succession and historical transitions between entities

association.label: Association
association.description: General relationship types for connections that don't fit other categories

member_of.description: Entity A is a formal member of organization or forum B. Use for official membership status.
member_of.example: Saudi Arabia is a member of G20
member_of.tip: Use for formal membership. For temporary event participation, use 'Participant in' instead.

participant_in.description: Entity A participates in event or engagement B. Use for temporary or event-based involvement.
participant_in.example: Ministry of Finance participates in the Annual Summit
participant_in.tip: Use for events and meetings. For permanent membership, use 'Member of' instead.

observer_of.description: Entity A has observer status in organization or forum B without full membership.
observer_of.example: Palestine is an observer of the United Nations
observer_of.tip: Use when the entity doesn't have voting rights or full membership status.

affiliate_of.description: Entity A is affiliated with organization B but operates independently.
affiliate_of.example: Research Institute is an affiliate of the University
affiliate_of.tip: Use for loose associations. For ownership, use 'Subsidiary of' instead.

parent_of.description: Organization A is the parent or controlling entity of organization B.
parent_of.example: Holding Company is parent of Subsidiary Corp
parent_of.tip: Direction matters: Parent → Child. Use from the parent organization's perspective.

subsidiary_of.description: Organization A is a subsidiary, branch, or controlled entity of organization B.
subsidiary_of.example: Regional Office is subsidiary of Global HQ
subsidiary_of.tip: Direction matters: Child → Parent. Use from the subsidiary's perspective.

represents.description: Person or organization A officially represents entity B in some capacity.
represents.tip: Use for official representation roles like ambassadors or delegates.

cooperates_with.description: Entities A and B have a cooperation agreement or work together on shared goals.
cooperates_with.example: Ministry A cooperates with Ministry B on joint projects
cooperates_with.tip: This is a two-way relationship. Use for ongoing cooperation, not one-time events.

bilateral_relation.description: Formal diplomatic or economic relationship between two countries.
bilateral_relation.example: Saudi Arabia has bilateral relations with UAE
bilateral_relation.tip: Best suited for country-to-country diplomatic relationships.

partnership.description: Strategic partnership or alliance between entities.
partnership.example: Organization A has a strategic partnership with Organization B
partnership.tip: Use for formal partnerships. For informal cooperation, use 'Cooperates with'.

participates_in.description: Entity actively takes part in another entity's activities or events.
participates_in.example: Country participates in the working group's initiatives
participates_in.tip: Use for active participation. For observation only, use 'Observer of'.

involves.description: Engagement or event A involves entity B. Use from the event's perspective.
involves.tip: Use from the engagement's perspective to list involved parties.

discusses.description: Engagement or working group A discusses topic B.
discusses.tip: Use to link engagements with their discussion topics.

hosted_by.description: Event or forum A is hosted by country or organization B.
hosted_by.example: Annual Conference is hosted by Saudi Arabia
hosted_by.tip: Use for physical hosting. For financial support, use 'Sponsored by'.

sponsored_by.description: Event or initiative A receives financial or official sponsorship from B.
sponsored_by.example: The initiative is sponsored by the World Bank
sponsored_by.tip: Use for financial backing. For physical hosting, use 'Hosted by'.

successor_of.description: Entity A succeeded or replaced entity B (historical transition).
successor_of.example: New Ministry is successor of former Department
successor_of.tip: Direction: New Entity → Old Entity. The newer entity is the source.

predecessor_of.description: Entity A preceded or was replaced by entity B (historical transition).
predecessor_of.example: Former Department is predecessor of new Ministry
predecessor_of.tip: Direction: Old Entity → New Entity. The older entity is the source.

related_to.description: General relationship between A and B that doesn't fit specific categories.
related_to.example: Topic A is related to Topic B
related_to.tip: Use as a last resort when no other type fits. Consider if a more specific type applies.
